title: 820 3476 - PP3V3_SUS missing
message:
Visual: clean board, no liquid damage. 2 exploded caps on PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V (C7570 & C7541), replaced.

S5 rails present, but no PP3V3_SUS. 

PM_DSW_PWRGD     3.4
PM_SLP_SUS_L         0
SMC_ADAPTER_EN  3.4
PM_BATLOW_L          0
PPVRTC                     3.4
PM_SLP_S5_L           3.3
PM_SLP_S4_L           0.2
S5_PWRGD               3.4

title: 820 3476 - PP3V3_SUS missing
message: Checked all rails for shorts? 2 shorted caps is not a common failure so something must have happened.

title: 820 3476 - PP3V3_SUS missing
message: It turns out PP3V3_SUS was shorted inside the board (near the BIOS). The board bulged slightly there and on the other side are some PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V caps. I think a short in that line caused the bulging and the shorting of the SUS rail. Anyway, thanks again Duke!

title: 820 3476 - PP3V3_SUS missing
message: Is the board getting warm there? Drill it out if so, nothing to loose anyway.

title: 820 3476 - PP3V3_SUS missing
message:
There's a limit to what I would do to my customer's boards Duke :) 
Anyway, it's on its way back.
